metadata.title: CVE-2021-26120 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Smarty before 3.1.39 allows code injection via an unexpected function nameafter a {function name= substring.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-26120` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

smarty3 - 3.1.21-1ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: smarty3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.21-1ubuntu1+esm1').
